Modification: Replaced cyano group (-C#N) with an amide group (-C(=O)N) to increase polar functional groups and hydrogen bonding sites.
Added a methyl group to the amide (-C(=O)NC) to slightly increase the basicity of the nitrogen.
Added a hydroxyl group (-OH) to increase polarity and hydrogen bonding capability.
Introduced a pyridine ring to add a nitrogen-containing heterocycle.
Added an additional amine group to increase the number of basic sites.
Added a methylated amine group to further increase the number of basic sites.
Added an ethylamine group to further increase the number of basic sites and amine groups.
Added an acetamide group to introduce a new polar group while maintaining amine functionality.
Added an aniline group to increase aromatic character and enhance π-π interactions with CO2.
Added a chloroethylamine group to introduce a halogen atom while maintaining amine functionality.
Added both chlorine and fluorine atoms to enhance electrostatic interactions with CO2.
Removed chlorine atom and kept only fluorine to reduce uncertainty while maintaining enhanced electrostatic interactions.
Changed the position of the fluorine atom to explore its effect on CO2 adsorption.
Introduced a fluoroacetamide group to combine polar amide functionality with a fluorine atom.
Extended the carbon chain of the fluoroacetamide group to create a 3-fluoropropanamide group.
Replaced fluorine with bromine to explore the effect of a larger halogen atom.
Introduced a difluoroacetamide group to increase electrostatic interactions.
Introduced a trifluoroacetamide group to further increase electrostatic interactions.
